text: Psalm 74
A Lament in Time of National Defeat
A maskil of Asaph.\f + \fr Ps 74 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Why, O God, have you rejected \add us\add* forever?
\add Why\add* does your anger smoke
against the sheep of your pasture?
Remember your congregation \add that\add* you bought long ago,
\add when\add* you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance.
\add Remember\add* ⸤Mount Zion⸥\f + \fr 74:2 \ft Literally “the mountain of Zion” \f* where you have dwelt.
Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins,
\add to\add* all \add that the\add* enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.
Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place;
they have set up their signs \add for\add* signs.
They are\f + \fr 74:5 \ft Hebrew “He is” \f* known \add to be\add* like \add those who\add* ⸤wield⸥\f + \fr 74:5 \ft Literally “lift up” \f*
axes in a thicket of trees.
And now\f + \fr 74:6 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* its\f + \fr 74:6 \ft That is, the temple’s \f* carved works altogether
they have smashed with axe and hammer.
They have set fire to your sanctuary.
They have defiled to the ground,
the dwelling place for your name.
They have said in their heart,
“We will completely\f + \fr 74:8 \ft Hebrew “altogether” \f* oppress them.”
They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
We do not see our signs,
and there is no longer a prophet.
No one with us knows how long.
How long, O God, will \add the\add* adversary taunt?
Will \add the\add* enemy treat your name with contempt forever?
Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?
\add Take it\add* from your bosom;\f + \fr 74:11 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* destroy \add them\add*!
But God \add has been\add* my king from long ago,
working salvation in the midst of the earth.
You split open \add the\add* sea by your strength;
You broke \add the\add* heads of \add the\add* sea monsters in the waters.
You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
you gave him \add as\add* food to \add the\add* desert dwelling creatures.
You split open spring and wadi.\f + \fr 74:15 \ft A seasonal stream that is often dry \f*
You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
Yours \add is the\add* day, yours \add is the\add* night also.
You established light and \add the\add* sun.
You defined\f + \fr 74:17 \ft Or “set” \f* all \add the\add* boundaries of \add the\add* earth;
Summer and winter—you formed them.
O Yahweh, remember this: \add the\add* enemy taunts,
and foolish people treat your name with contempt.
Do not give to beasts the life of your dove;
do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.
Have regard for the covenant,
because \add the\add* dark places of \add the\add* land are full of
\add the\add* haunts of violence.
Do not let \add the\add* oppressed turn back humiliated;
let \add the\add* poor and needy praise your name.
Rise up, O God, plead your cause;
remember the reproaching of you by \add the\add* foolish ⸤all day long⸥.\f + \fr 74:22 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
Do not forget the sound of your adversaries,
the roar of those rising up against you ascending continually.
